gov.nasa.larcfm.Util

Interface EuclideanProjection

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AziEquiProjection, ENUProjection, FlatEarthProjection, OrthographicProjection, SimpleNoPolarProjection, SimpleProjection

    public interface EuclideanProjection
    This is an interface for local Euclidean projections around a given point. This projection may be used to transform geodesic coordinates (LatLonAlt objects) into this Euclidean frame, using the project() method. Also points within this frame, may be found in geodesic coordinates with the inverse() method. As long as the points are close to the projection point, the errors should be very small. Euclidean positions will be with respect to a projection point (this becomes the origin of the new Euclidean space). Note that this will often alter relative position altitude information as well! If this is not desired, the projection should be made against a zero-altitude point. EuclideanProjection objects should never be created directly. Instead they should be retrieved via the Projection.createProjection() method.
